intro: Brittonella pilosa, commonly known as the hairy brittonella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, almost fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Brittonella pilosa is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique and visually striking member of the Apiaceae family.
